intro: Cota dipsacea, commonly known as the mountain cota, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at elevations ranging from 1,500 to 3,000 meters. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to white, with a distinctive central disk surrounded by ray florets. Cota dipsacea is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands, where it thrives in well-drained conditions.
